properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 9 at 2:46PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

Tippecanoe River...Wildcat Creek...Eel River...Sugar Creek...

..Lowland flooding will develop along and these rivers in western and central Indiana.
Significant flooding along Wildcat Creek, and Sugar Creek is likely. Flooding will affect
some local and state roads...low agricultural land and some river parks. Flooding will
begin between Saturday morning and Saturday afternoon. A second system could prolong
flooding along these rivers through next week.

A significant precipitation event will begin Thursday night and continue through Sunday
Morning. Heaviest rainfall rates will be between Friday night and Saturday afternoon.
Forecasted rainfall totals between 2 to 5 inches this weekend could cause flooding similar
to floods along the Sugar Creek in June 1998 and floods along Wildcat Creek in June 2010.
Moderate flooding is expected along Wildcat Creek and Sugar Creek. Along the Tippecanoe River
and Eel River, minor to moderate flooding is expected.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
* from Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* At  1:45 PM Thursday the stage was 3.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 18.9 feet by Sunday evening.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
